website_summaries.verdict: Epson's new dye-based 13-inch printer has style and prints large photos, but its black-and-white prints are less than perfect.

customer_reviews.title: workhouse printer
customer_reviews.text: used it printer for years. great printer from epson. have been an epson user for many years and just recently moved to canon, but still uses the epson. this stands up against years of use. prints are beautifiul. use OEM ink for convenience or buy CIS to safe on ink but the quality on most CIS isn't as good as OEM. in terms of quality, this printer is excellent. well made and just works and keeps working.
customer_reviews.author: GhostHog

customer_reviews.title: Ink Hog!
customer_reviews.text: It will cost you more money for the ink withing one year of purchase than the cost of the printer. I've had this printer for more than three years and although the color print quality is very good, if you calculate the cost printing a certain quantity of 8x10 photos against the cost of having the same number of prints done commercially, you can save money by having the photos printed commercially. Probably well worth the cost in the long run to go for a good color laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Opinions

customer_reviews.title: Diappointing
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer about six months, and it has really been a let-down. I bought it for photos and CDs. For a couple months it produced lovely photos. Now, the ink has to be recalibrated every time, which takes about 45 mins and pounds of ink. After calibration, it prints about 20 good-looking photos, and then they look like trash again. For such an expensive printer, I expected better. The CDs on the special tray always come out looking great. For that, I give this two stars. I wish I had bought a cheaper printer. I will NEVER buy another Epson.
customer_reviews.author: red

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: If I listened to all the negative reviews I would not have purchased the 1400. It's replacing my Epson Stylus 1280..... Absolutely the best 200 bucks I ever spent. The print quality is equal if not slightly better than the 1280. Installation was a breeze on a Mac, In the last 3 days I have printed 12 border-less 11/14's and my ink still shows 100% When it's time to purchase new ink, I'll be heading to [..] for their refill kits. I've used them for 8 years now without a single complaint. Don't hesitate to purchase this printer. You'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Espon Stylus Photo 1400
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 3-year-old Epson 260 - the 260 was finicky about ink cartridges and they were expensive, this and the cartridges did not last very long. The 1400 has proved to be ink efficient and authentic Epson cartridges are available in OEM packaging at about half the cost of the retail boxed cartridges. My main use of this printer is for printing on CD/DVD media and the 1400 is so superior to the 260 I highly recommend this printer if your use of it is for the CD/DVD media printing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B. Jontez

customer_reviews.title: Versatile printer
customer_reviews.text: I had a HP printer before this Epson. When I got a new MacBook Pro the HP wouldn't work with it. I ordered the Epson Stylus Photo 1400 because I do scrap booking and I liked the feature of being able to print 12 x 12. Another thing I love about this printer is that I can print virtually any size paper, which I couldn't do with the HP. So I can print off verses for odd sized home-made greeting cards, or print odd sized journaling for my scrap books. The colors are good and photos are sharp and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Glitter Girl

customer_reviews.title: I was fine with that
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 of these. One I used until the day the error code said, "Parts of your printer are at end of life" and it stopped printing. I was fine with that. That printer lasted over 7 years! The second one I had stored in a closet. It was for an employee who is no longer with me. I pulled it out after not printing on it for over 3 years. After replacing only 2 cartridges, it still worked!!!! They print beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Lensink

customer_reviews.title: bad printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer does not work. I called EPSON and they could not get it to work. I want to return it. I even put all new ink in it.as suggested by Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer (if you buy compatible inkjet cartridges)
customer_reviews.text: Epson outdid themselves on this printer. I have owned 8 other Epson inkjets & their earlier monochrome Action Laser Printer. Utilization of the 1400 would be nightmarish if compatible inkjet cartridges were not available. This machine slurps the inkjet at an alarming rate, but the quality is to be commended. Luckily I found a supplier of quality ink jet cartridges at a reasonable price ($6. per cartridge)
customer_reviews.author: John Q Justice

customer_reviews.title: Very nice printer makes big beautiful photos.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Epson 1400 to replace a 1280 that I had for 8 years. I loved my 1280, but when it broke down, the 1400 was on sale, so I took the plunge. The newer printer is faster and the quality is even better. I am a little scared about the price of ink since all of the colors are separate, but I should not have to buy them as often (I hope). This printer makes great photos up to 13"x19" full bleed and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Lenz

customer_reviews.title: This printer started great, but it's falling apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for my Father last year. He's printed approximately 2,000 4x6 prints and in the last several months the print quality has severely degraded. It requires two to three major cleanings to get decent image quality on OEM inks - regardless of frequency of use. I'm familiar with Epson as I'm a large format digital printer by trade, but this is not a machine I'd recommend at all. Price point was decent, but I would've spent more on a printer that was meant to be run and not used sparsely. If you have any inclination to print a substantial amount of digital prints this is not the machine to buy.
customer_reviews.author: john szalkowski

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Read about the problems with early notices of ink being out, but so far no problems. Have printed one fairly large job with a big use of one color. Was half expecting some sign that I needed new cartridges, but haven't had that yet. I am a graphic arts students with lots of large size (portfolio) projects so needed a less expensive large format printer, and so far this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: ksj

customer_reviews.title: Amazing printer
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the best printer Epson has every created. I've had this thing for 5 years now and it still prints better than stuff on the shelve out now. Professional quality work! If you are a designer or creative person, this is the best printer for you!
customer_reviews.author: SAS

customer_reviews.title: MAKE SURE YOU GET THE RIGHT INK!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Epson 1400, quirky but works fine. However, as a package deal, Amazon.com couples the wrong ink with this printer under "FREQUENTLY BOUGHT TOGETHER." #78 Ink cartridges DO NOT FIT into this printer. You have to buy Epson #79 for the Epson Stylus 1400. I got caught to the tune of $66.67, don't let it happen to you. Hopefully Amazon.com will rectify this situation soon.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent prints at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: This is one killer printer. I have been printing 8 1/2 x 11 and 4x6 and it does a remarkable job. It also prints my business cards with no problems either. I have not had time to use the cd print feature and the largest print size. All said, I think that for the price, this is the best printer for photographers on the market.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Puett

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know what to do
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t been able to print nothing out whenever I try to print the green button is solid the red ink button is on though i bought some black ink I was wondering what do I need for it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Quintez Coley

customer_reviews.title: Printer-Head clogs despite the built-in nozzle cleaning system.
customer_reviews.text: I use this printer in combination with sublimation inks for my heat transfer t-shirt system. There is a built-in nozzle cleaning system that the manufacture states will prevent clogs at the printing-head, but all it seem to do is make noise, than provide a cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Del S.

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and start making great prints right out of the box. I used a package of 13" x 19" Office Max photo paper (not even Epson's brand) and achieved perfect results. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it does use a fair bit of ink, but it doesn't appear to be unreasonable considering the size of the image and the fact that it is 100% coverage. So far I've printed a dozen images and one cartridge is at 25%, two are at 50%, and the other 3 are at 75% or more. I couldn't be more happy at the quality for this price.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with it and the company sent a new one right away. If you are in need of this special printer it is good for the money. Ink isnt cheap at all. Make sure you know before hand if this is the kind of printing you do, large scale and wide. If it is, company stands by their product.Very Happy
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Major hardware and software issues
customer_reviews.text: This is the worse printer I have ever had. When it works it is a great printer. The cartridges do not always register in the printer and then you can not print. It has to be on the top ten of the most unreliable printer in existence and Epson does nothing to help.
customer_reviews.author: Roachfl

customer_reviews.title: Love my new printer
customer_reviews.text: Great guy!! delivered a little early!! there was great care put into the printer from previous owner!! Works great connected the CIS system to it and had no problems... thinking about making it a dtg in the near future and I'm sure it'll perform great but til then I will enjoy
customer_reviews.author: India

customer_reviews.title: Absolutly LUV my printer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my 1400 for almost 1 month and I am thrilled with it. My old printer was a Stylus 1280 which was great for 4 years. The new printer far surpasses the old in quietness and ink usage. I have printed 8 8"x10" photos, 12 8"x10"prints of paintings, over 300 invitations to my latest art exhibit, plus just every day stuff such as letters, calendars, etc. I have bought a new set of inks but haven't replaced the ones that came with the 1400. Several of them are quite low but I do believe I am using less ink.
customer_reviews.author: Jo A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer... Ink is pricey but at least you don't have to replace them all at once. I like that there are individual cartridges so you only replace what's out. Great quality photo printing and prints directly on cd/dvd as well!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P. Slaton

customer_reviews.title: Epson Stylus Photo 1400 Printer
customer_reviews.text: I make my living taking photographs. I have been using the 1400 for a couple of months. It is a great printer for my purposes. I mostly use it for portfolio prints, and promo cards. Otherwise for word processing too. Hook up and install to my iMac was simple. It worked right away. It does suck up a lot of ink. The price for the printer at Amazon was low, but the cost of ink is high. Seems like Epson is in the ink business more than printers, but don't want to risk gumming up the works with generic inks.
customer_reviews.author: pictoinfo

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I already owned an Epson 1400 when I spotted this ad on Amazon. The printer is one of the best I've ever used (In the 13" x 19" category). The price was the deciding factor for me. I'll be using the second printer as a back-up although I've had no problems with the first one. I am a professional digital artist and I run ink jets all day long. The Epson Photo 1400 is a good solid work horse that produces very high quality images. I would recommend it to any digital artist who wants to produce their own finished prints.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known that at some point, you get a message that the ink pads need replacing. Replacement costs as much as a new printer. If I had known, I would not have purchased it, nor used it for everyday printing. When it worked, it was great.
customer_reviews.author: kbartist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I rated this printer at four stars only because its an ink hog. To be fair, I print high resolution photos so I suppose thats to be expected. As for the quality of prints, my friends ooh and ahh over them. I like the way it handles high-key landscape photos. In all, an excellent printer. Now, if they just made bulk magazine cartridges...
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Florey

customer_reviews.title: Quirky - print quality & paper feed
customer_reviews.text: Owned since 2007. Print quality is eratic. For example, lines sometimes appear across color printouts of photos or graphics. "Head cleaning" to resolve this problem doesn't always work, is very time consuming & uses a lot of ink. Recently (Dec 2013) the printer won't feed paper. I tried EPSON cleaning sheet which did not help. I would not recommend this product because of the above problems and annoyances‎. Note that I am a low volume user of this printer. Conisdering all this, the product is absolutely not robust enough for any environment.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Only used my Epson 1400 a few time so far, but, it seems to make very good 13x19's. May use alot of ink, but kind of expect that for the size of prints and quality. I am very satisfied with this printer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Genominelli

customer_reviews.title: Does Just what I want
customer_reviews.text: Quality was surprisingly good. Uses ink up fast when the settings aren't tweaked. But highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Epson 1400
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Epson printer I have owned. My last one was a R200. I purchased this one so I could print on my own CDs and I also liked the large format for printing. I have had this printer for less than a day but it is working great. I printed a couple CDs and printed an image on 9x12 Bristol board without any issues at all. I recommend this to anyone looking to print anything larger than 8.5x11, or on CDs or DVDs.
customer_reviews.author: Karl T.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive printer to upkeep.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive printer to upkeep. Greedy Epson rejects recyclable generic cartridges while their genuine epson ink cartridges are overpriced and not that reliable. If I buy an expensive $400 printer. I expect to use whatever quality materials I want, because I own the printer and I want to get the best printing performance. Epson intentional sabotages their consumers by forcing their users to use their brand of poor quality inks. I own other large format printers and Epson tend to need more baby sitting.
customer_reviews.author: B L

customer_reviews.title: Great printer--good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer for someone who needs a large format printer. I am a graphic designer and I use it to proof 11x17 newsletters. My last stylus photo printer lasted 10 years. This is an improvement because there are 6 ink cartridges instead of 2. My only complaint is that ink is so expensive, but all ink jet printers have that problem. So I still recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: scdesign

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 14 months!
customer_reviews.text: Print quality was great then it suddenly lost horizontal registration and started printing an obvious amount of pixels off - it looked like it was printing ultra bold when printing black - but when printing bar codes, they were not clear, and would not scan properly. I print a lot, but I expect better life than this! I contacted support about this and they said it must be a motherboard problem, but since it was out of warranty I would have to pay to get it repaired. The repair would have cost more than a new printer, so I bought a new printer - from another manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Spencer

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer, because it gave me good quality pictures. People have said it uses a lot of ink quickly, and I agree it does suck a lot of ink. However, I am not surprised since it IS a photo printer, and has individual cartridges. The only thing I will gripe about is that it does NOT come with a cable to hook up the printer to the computer. So go and buy the a to b ( i think? ) usb cable.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H. Lighter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: The prints are fantastic quality. We use this as a dedicated photo printer. Always use the Epson ink and the highest quality papaer - it makes a difference. Be aware that the printer is huge! If you're looking for a desktop, mulitpurpose, photo/document printer, don't buy this unit - it's just to large.
customer_reviews.author: johnm1000

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this for myself in December, and love it so far. The built-in ICM profiles are pretty good (though a little better if you make your own) and the pictures that it prints look great on both glossy and matte, color or B/W. Easy to use, reliable, great price on Amazon.com!
customer_reviews.author: BBooDad

customer_reviews.title: The Best Printer for Hi-Def Photos
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the best hi-def photo printer I've ever had....and exceptional value for the money. In a very short time after it's arrival, it paid for itself by printing top quality photos for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hind

customer_reviews.title: good printer
customer_reviews.text: like others have noted, this printer can consume ink, but it seems the more i use it, the less i think of it as an ink hog. i use it for everyday projects (word processing, etc) and its just fine. i am also a professional photographer and this printer gives me excellent results. i prefer prints on matte paper and this printer yields rich, true-to-life colors on matte paper.
customer_reviews.author: prairieghost

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: I've used this printer for the production of printable CD's as well as large format photos. Every job has been perfect. The CD software works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Dot creek fisherman

customer_reviews.title: a LOT of aggravation...
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer over a year ago, mainly because I needed something to print images onto CD's, and also for general office printing. The print quality on the CD's was really lacking, the colors were way off (heavily magenta), and I had to adjust my images to compensate for the color issues. I would NOT recommend for printing photos. I've used it since for office printing, and when it's working, it's fine, but there are so many times that it gets a printer error, and doesn't give any details on what's wrong. The ink runs out quickly and is expensive to replace. I wish I would have spent a little more and got something more reliable and higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Marie

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm using Epson's "Ultra Premium Presentation Paper Matte" paper, images look great. I also used the "Ultra Premium Photo Paper Glossy" paper for smaller sized images. The colors are vibrant, but perhaps a bit too red and slightly over-saturated. I'm printing with Photoshop's default color profile and not Epson's, since Photoshop's starting point is more accurate (Epson's profile is too green). I've only had to tweak on the glossy prints, the archival matte surface paper is accurate from print number one.
customer_reviews.author: art guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for graphic design!
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently a student studying graphic design and have kicked myself for going to Kinko's and not getting this printer sooner. It has a wide range of print capabilities, and the print quality is awesome. If you find yourself wanting to print high quality photos, this printer is an ideal investment.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wunn

customer_reviews.title: Epson 1400
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Did really nice job on 13 X 19 prints. Does a nice job on printable DVDs.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin L. Nunley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my husband best thing I did still using it
customer_reviews.author: Sandra C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This printer has excellent clarity and color. Also it is very user friendly and easy to understand the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Madison

customer_reviews.title: Banding
customer_reviews.text: Barely used this printer at all for over a year and then kicked back into photography mode again and the printer prints horrible horizontal banding in every photo I print. Ink cartridges are a pain in the ass to get as you cannot buy them in stores and they are expensive as hell and the paper loader fails and requires cleaning in order for it to work properly. Skip Epson all together and go with another brand, their printers get consistently worse reviews than competing serious photographer photo printers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Love Epson Stylus Photo 1400
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fast good quality photo prints love the large paper size. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Darnell A. Hazel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Printer was shipped and arrived within two days. Plugged it in and ran like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Trosclair

customer_reviews.title: My answer to this product.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. It was easy to install and prints very well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cook

customer_reviews.title: epson works great
customer_reviews.text: great works great! would be nice if they told you that the printer doesnt come included with a USB cord! :/
customer_reviews.author: L. Cypher

customer_reviews.title: Epson Stylus 1400/Epson Customer Service Apathy
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this printer for immediate use on an important report. We had it shipped overnight and when it arrived we, after setting it up, discovered that one of the new ink cartridges was defective. After talking to a barely intelligible customer service rep he agreed to send us a replacement cartridge. I informed him that we really needed this part expedited. He assured me that it would be shipped FedEx. It was; FedEx GROUND. It took over a week. We couldn't wait so we bought one at Amazon. Indifference reigns at Epson!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M. Curtiss

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at all
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all.I have already e-mailed on Friday about my dilemma.I paid over $17.00 for shipping,and it took 3 days short of one month to get to my house.On my printers arrival it will not work.I goes through the motion and the a popping noise and shuts off.I would like to send it back and get my money back.I really just want a printer that works.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the second printer we have ordered in 2 weeks, the paper feed is not working correctly, the print quality is the worst, and tech support was useless. You will be wasting your money if you buy this printer. I am sending my second printer back for the same reasons as the first. My employee has spent 2 days trying to get both of these printers to work correctly now after precious time & wasted payroll I am sending it back. I will never order this type of printer again
customer_reviews.author: Bosslady

customer_reviews.title: Epson 1400 printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer was accurately represented, well packaged, and shipped promptly. It is an excellent printer. My only complaint is that a half dozen prints set out to dry in a room emit a strong objectionable odor. Epson has their work cut out for them.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. McCamy

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I don't know how to use it at first,and contact to the seller. But finally I can use it. It is good and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: syusuke

customer_reviews.title: Epson 1400
customer_reviews.text: The Epson 1400 I ordered is exactly what I needed. Shipping was fast and price was reasonable. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie L. Gill

product_meta.title: Epson Stylus Photo 1400 Wide-Format Color Inkjet Printer (C11C655001)
feature_bullets: Creates 4 x 6 inch photo prints with maximum resolution of 5760 by 1440 optimized dpi in less than 1 minute
Prints 8x10 inch images in under two minutes
Six individual, high-capacity Claria Hi-Definition ink cartridges create high-quality smudge, water, scratch, and fade resistant prints
Features a PictBridge port for PC-free photo printing from digital cameras and mobile camera phones
